intro: Acer skutchii, commonly known as the Skutch maple, is a rare deciduous tree native to the mountainous regions of China. It belongs to the genus Acer, which includes various maple species known for their distinctive foliage. The tree is characterized by its small, palmate leaves that turn vibrant red in the fall. It typically grows at elevations between 2,000 and 3,500 meters, preferring cool and moist climates. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, Acer skutchii is considered a rare and endangered species.
